intro: Iria fimbristyloides, commonly known as the Brazilian flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage. Iria fimbristyloides is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
